website_summaries.verdict: The Lumia 950 is a mostly average smartphone, giving iPhone and Android users no reason to switch, and offering little appeal outside Windows phone diehards.
pros: Microsoft's Lumia 950 takes good pictures, has a crystal clear screen and a removable battery
The Cortana voice assistant and offline maps remain perks
cons: Windows phones still have a huge app deficit compared to iPhone and Android
The 950's standout Continuum feature is buggy and cumbersome, and requires separate hardware to use
The phone's ho-hum design feels dated

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone is wonderful! It is sophisticated with wonderful features. The screen and camera are fantastic. Concerning apps, I have found all the ones I need.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone. Brought this second one for family member.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo R Sifuentes

customer_reviews.title: a welcome improvement
customer_reviews.text: I like Nokia, Microsoft phones. They are extremely reliable. The only problem was that they never came with enough built in memory. Especially for apps from today's market. The 950 phone takes great photographs, the memory increase also helps everything run much smoother. I was sorry to see Microsoft get out of the phone business. I understand the economics. But just the fact that I don't get a lot of junk popups on my phone such as what Android phones get. Means a great deal to me. It helps a lot when you're in a business mode that you don't need to see a bunch of garbage pop up on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Phone is great, but was NOT unlocked!
customer_reviews.text: The Lumia 950 is a very nice phone. It has a good build quality, feels very comfortable in the hand. Has a good weight to it and looks very stylish. However, this phone was NOT unlocked when I received it, although it was advertised that it would be. It was still locked to AT&T. When I asked the seller for the unlock code, I was advised to return the phone for a full refund. Quality controll of their customer service is very poor!
customer_reviews.author: ArieXiet

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have finally begun to use the cell phone. It is very good in all areas except the battery life. Whn it is idle the battery needs to be charged every other day. When it is being used the battery runs down in 4 hours and that is not constant use. Otherwise very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Adams

customer_reviews.title: I love my 950
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago and it's still going strong n it's been through hell n back. I've dropped it so many times that i don't remember how many time that i've dropped it lol. The screen has so many cracks in it that it ain't funny no more. I don't really need the second sim anymore either. I've replaced the battery once. all functions work just like the day that i got it. If this thing does ever break i'll most definitely buy another one--provided that it is still being made?
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: The set up was not like Windows Phones of the past. I had to select and pin each app myself. It did not automatically populate as previous phones when I entered my Microsoft ID. Otherwise the phone is great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Gray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, amazing camera. I'm a big fan of the Lumias.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 640 was a better cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: Poor battery life. The 640 was a much better cell phone. Will be changing to a Samsung Android soon. Going to miss the old Windows phones, they were reliable, easy to operate and I was never hacked into.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Last generation of window phone
customer_reviews.text: Good phone, dual sim that I used att and tmobile running at the same time. I believe this is the last generation of window phone. Nice to get before running out. Only drawback is the battery only last for one day or 2 days in light use. Make sure to turn off GPS, bluetooth, etc when not in use or it will drain a lot of your battery. Over all good phone.
customer_reviews.author: SMX

customer_reviews.title: W10 mobile
customer_reviews.text: The operating system"w10" is remarkable. The telephone aesthetics are not great but the characteristics and performance are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apps on phone not too good
customer_reviews.text: This phone doesn't allow for Snapchat, Spotify, or Waze app. Also, I was always told my voice was not heard clearly on phone calls. The phone itself though is durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: FactsDontCareAboutYourFeelings

customer_reviews.title: Unlock code
customer_reviews.text: The phone is supposed to be unlocked but when I try with a sim card, I am being requested to enter unlock code.
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone....love the picture quality. Took it to an AT & T store, and they had it going on my Go Phone plan in just a few minutes. Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Nokia quality held back by Windows operating system. Improving, but still needs work on the software.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Brown

customer_reviews.title: Long live windows phones
customer_reviews.text: The basic battery is very very bad. MUST BUY ANOTHER BATTERY.
customer_reviews.author: Jicon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: love the phone, but the camera has already gone out.
customer_reviews.author: R.Llamas

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone works great... except that the charger seemed to work only that initial time...bummer! There are enough apps to keep me happy, and everything's familiar. Good productivity tools.
customer_reviews.author: Alism

customer_reviews.title: the apps are few...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great phone but you have to use the same Microsoft store for apps, and they have only a few I like.
customer_reviews.author: Since1999

customer_reviews.title: I also got Microsoft display adopter that I attached it to my TV then connect my phone to my TV in wireless mode it works realy
customer_reviews.text: truly it replaces the computer , I also got Microsoft display adopter that I attached it to my TV then connect my phone to my TV in wireless mode it works realy good I go on the internet and youtube and play everything on the TV no problem, just one problem so far I experienced is anyconnect VPN from cisco does not work , keep asking to retype your password and then after a few times try it give error 602
customer_reviews.author: Masoud M

customer_reviews.title: Highly Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've ever owned! Had it for about 3 months now and it's worked flawlessly! My service is through T-Mobile. Since the phone runs Windows 10 it receives all the frequent updates directly from Microsoft. No more waiting months for T-Mobile to push them out like I had to with my Lumia 925. Other miscellaneous thoughts... My university uses Office 365 and Outlook on this phone syncs up beautifully. I got the Tudia case, about $8, adds minimal bulk. Also bought the 2 Day task app which integrates nicely with my OneDrive account.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Scholtz, PhD, RD

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of work ended up sending it back to the company
customer_reviews.author: Kimba

customer_reviews.title: Phone and Windows 10 mobile maybe be an good/OK phone ...
customer_reviews.text: Phone and Windows 10 mobile maybe be an good/OK phone and system but many many apps are not available for this (airlines, banks, stereo controllers, mobile providers usage apps etc etc) - the list goes on. Now that Microsoft has essentially ditched mobile phones (in spite of their promises a year ago) don't expect things to improve - rather the reverse. Support is now 'pathetic' also. So be sure you know what you are letting yourself in for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Phone Ever
customer_reviews.text: The only thing Android phones have over this one are the number of apps that are available. Other than that, this phone is better feature by feature than any Android or Apple phone on the market. The ease of use, camera, apps and privacy are all far superior. Too bad Microsoft no longer supports the platform. Shame on them, but not surprising. Typical of Microsoft to give up too soon.
customer_reviews.author: ToHelpOthers

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am windows phone user since 5 years. I upgrade to this phone after crashing my 1520 multiple times. Maybe I was not ready for big screens. So, skipped 950 XL. This is much better size on the hands and the pockets. I miss my 1520 for media consumption but 950 is a very good replacement with newer hardware/better screen resolution/windows hello (after anniversary update).
customer_reviews.author: Raj G

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, however, no developer will make apps for it, except Microsoft. I feel left out with it
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself is great! Love it! I hate people who make apps, hate Windows phones. For this reason alone, I bought another phone powered by Android. In this world, if you're not on Android, or Apple, you're left out in the cold with Windows. The only developer for Windows phones apps is Microsoft, only because it's their phone. No one else supports Windows phones. It sucks! I hate it! I went back to Android, because I felt cut off from the rest of the world with a Windows phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike V.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I Love my Lumia 950 and I am really glad to have software on my phone that perfectly ties to my computer. It's a perfect replacement for the Blackberry Lovers I do wish it was a little smaller with a slide out keyboard I still miss that feature
customer_reviews.author: Miss Dee

customer_reviews.title: Dual Sim
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Much better than Android or Apple unfortunately Win 10 is a substandard version from previous Win 8. OS fails to operate as cleanly as the Win 8. Still a good phone. It is a shame Windows failed on the phone market. .
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kilburn

customer_reviews.title: Best best best
customer_reviews.text: Best phone in market... Runs very fast and too good..
customer_reviews.author: Pankaj A.

customer_reviews.title: Astonishingly great OS, hardware unimpressive, wish MS hadnt sucked the life from Nokia
customer_reviews.text: Love Win10 but MS clearly cheaped out on the execution of this handset. E.g. the flimsy plastic back shell is so bad that a whole third party business has emerged selling higher quality replacements. Which is really a shame because Win10 is breathtakingly good, fast, easy, attractive, effective.
customer_reviews.author: Royce W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy from them!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone but the ones they sell start to have problems after only four months. Get it from Microsoft if you want it to work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Microsoft Lumia 950 32GB Dual Sim NAM RM-1118 GSM Factory Unlocked - US Warranty (Black)
product_meta.description: Lumia 950: Turn an ordinary moment into your biggest feat with the Microsoft Lumia 950. It has a stunning 5.2-inch Quad HD display and a lightning-fast hexa-core processor. Its 20MP camera features ZEISS optics and a triple LED natural flash. Plus, it works seamlessly with Windows 10 devices, making it the phone that works like a PC. Exciting new features: We’re extremely proud to bring you some revolutionary new ways to use your phone – dock the Lumia 950 and Windows apps scale up on a big screen. Want a personal log in experience? Use Windows Hello beta to unlock the Lumia 950 without entering a pin code. Powered by Windows: Windows 10 keeps your digital life in sync across all your devices. All your apps, games, and music are in one convenient place with the Windows Store. And Cortana provides reminders on your Windows 10 devices. Plus, Office is easy to use on the 5.2-inch screen, and Outlook has the same rich editing tools as Microsoft Word. Battery: Replaceable battery 3000mAh, 3.8V, Built-in wireless charging, fast charging, Wireless charging standard: Qi, Max standby time: Up to 275 hr, Max talk time: Up to 18 hr, Max music playback time: 63 hr, Max Wi-Fi network browsing time: 11 hr, Max video playback time: 10 hr. Compatible with GSM carriers. LTE FDD network: Band 1 (2100MHz), Band 17 (700MHz), Band 2 (1900MHz), Band 20 (800MHz), Band 3 (1800MHz), Band 4 (1700/2100 MHz), Band 5 (850MHz), Band 7 (2600MHz), Band 8 (900MHz), Band 28 (700MHz), Band 12 (700MHz). TD-LTE network: Band 38 (2570-2620MHz), Band 40 (2300-2400MHz), Band 41 partially (2555-2575 MHz)
feature_bullets: 20MP camera with ZEISS optics, 32GB storage/expandable to 200GB via microSD or Microsoft OneDrive cloud storage, Compatible with GSM 850MHz, 900MHz, 1800MHz, and 1900MHz carriers.
Its hexa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 808 1800 MHz processor hums right through videos and graphic-intense games as well as runs multiple apps simultaneously.
Built to do great things: Your digital life comes to life on the stunning 5.2-inch WQHD (2560 x 1440) display (TrueColor (24-bit/16M), AMOLED, ClearBlack, 564ppi).
With USB-C fast charging and an extra-large battery, you’ll always have plenty of power no matter what.
Magic happens in a flash that’s why the Lumia’s 20MP camera has been engineered to virtually eliminate motion blur. Boasting unique features like Rich Capture and triple LED natural flash.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars70 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
